experience: You and Craig both know Glen Chamberlain, Lucas Krause, and 23 others
You both worked at EPIC Research and Diagnostics
Craig worked at EPIC Research and Diagnostics after you started

•	Part of a 2 person software development team.•	Leveraged numerous Microsoft and .NET open source projects.•	Created web service using C#, ASP.NET Web API, NHibernate, AutoMapper, FluentValidator, DataFlow, Task Parallel Library, SQL Server 2014 R2, and JSON.NET.•	Developed thick client using C#, Windows Forms, ReactiveUI, Reactive Extensions, AutoMapper, FluentValidator, and JSON.NET•	Wrote over 200+ unit and system tests to test all layers of the code using MSTest, Moq, AutoMocker, and Dapper. •	Helped integrate R model developed by statistician into the C# application.  •	Worked with biostatistician in translating SAS and SPSS to application implementations.  •	Implemented Git source control to replace TFS source control.•	Utilized best practices for ALM with TFS for use in FDA approval of SDLC.•	Integrated with MatLab dlls for image analysis.•	Handled algorithm development to build scoring based on the analysis.•	Responsible for handling integration with different USB devices and maintaining connected/disconnected state.•	Added logging using Log4Net to both client and server processes.•	Built video recorder application to communicate with USB camera devices.•	Handled ad-hoc reporting requirements for all levels of the business.•	Helped with product requirements writing and maintenance. •	Involved in HIPAA support and preparation for rollout to Microsoft Azure Cloud.•	Wrote many prototypes within Azure for determining Azure rollout plans.  •	These prototypes included Azure Service Fabric (Stateless and Stateful Services as well as Actors), Azure App Services with WebJobs, Azure Service Bus Queue, and Azure storage.

• 	Manage and support 11 developers of varying skillsets.  •	Provide expert knowledge and guidance of existing technologies.•	Create and maintain the 300+ SQL Server Reporting Services and Web Reports•	Responsible for all data refreshes between the 3 different database technologies•	Architect and maintain best practices and procedures to help facilitate quick and effective development of requirements.•	Evaluate and analyze proposed product changes to identify and review potential impacts on overall system functionality and business operations. •	Perform code review of product/system changes prior to implementation in production.•	Manage crisis situations which involve complex technical hardware or software problems. •	Implement new processes to improve performance and extensibility of existing systems.•	Serve as support and subject matter expert for staff.•	Provide support to Oracle application functional areas to meet specific and unique information objectives. •	Technical liaison between IT and users•	Deliver end user system training, system orientation and trains associates on production support procedures and processes.•	Track and respond to inquiries, problems, and requests for information via the ticketing system. •	Evaluate requests and assign to appropriate IT staff.•	Ensure standardization in application and system development.

•	Developed software: specifically wrote code, test cases for new and existing software products.•	Participated in code reviews, software design and development process.•	Lead and mentored associate software engineers•	Developed software system testing procedures, programming, and documentation•	Built a transaction processing system for a vending machine utilizing C#, LINQ to SQL, and SQL Server 2008.•	Developed and bug fixed numerous Crystal Reports.

•	Maintained a nightly batch system that would read data from SQL 2000 HR Database.  This data would be passed to the ADP Payroll system as flat files.  ADP would process and send back more flat files that the system would load into the SQL 2000 HR Database.  This happened nightly during the weekdays.•	Responsible for developing and delivering ad hoc report requests in SQL Server 2000.•	Developed and maintained an ASP.NET application to handle internal efficiency and money making ideas.•	Responsible for maintaining the legacy VB 6 batch process.  •	Maintained data in the SQL 2000 Database.•	Developed and maintained numerous Benefit Feed files to various carriers. •	Responsible for maintaining and enhancing the triggers, stored procedures, views, functions, and tables in the HR system.•	Handled maintenance on the employee self-service system

recommendations: September 20, 2016, Richard was senior to Craig but didn’t manage directly

Craig was our lead Software Developer at EPIC Research & Diagnostics.  Not only was the quality of his work excellent, but he completed several projects ahead of schedule, which enabling us to add additional features in to a release.  Additionally, he recommended and managed another software engineer, demonstrating good selection and managerial skills.  He was well-liked and respected by all in the company.  I highly recommend Craig as a software developer.

April 22, 2016, Craig reported directly to Raghu

It's rare you find someone that is as passionate about technology and programming as Raghu.  I had the pleasure of reporting to Raghu for the past year and half.  We were the main programmers in the company and were responsible for developing the software end to end.  Raghu was instrumental in building out and defining the development process in preparation for audits.  Raghu's attention to detail and willingness to take the path less traveled served the company over and over again.  He would always try to find the best technology for the problem and is completely open to off the wall ideas in trying to solve the technology problems we were faced with.Raghu will be a valuable asset to any technical team and company.
